IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ASSIST WOUNDED, ILL & INJURED SERVICE MEMBERS, VETERANS & MILITARY FAMILIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE FUND CARES FOR OUR NATION'S CRITICALLY WOUNDED, ILL, AND INJURED SERVICE MEMBERS, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. WE ASSIST ALL MILITARY BRANCHES, INCLUDING BOTH POST-9/11 AND VIETNAM VETERANS, PROVIDING ONE-ON-ONE CASE MANAGEMENT, CONNECTION AND LIFETIME SUPPORT.
IRS990.Desc: OUR SERVICE MEMBER AND FAMILY SUPPORT PROGRAM PROVIDES DIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FOR EXPENSES THAT ARE MOST PRESSING DURING HOSPITALIZATION AND RECOVERY. THE PROGRAM CONTINUES TO OFFER SPECIALIZED SUPPORT TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES ONCE THEY RETURN HOME. AREAS OF ASSISTANCE OFFERED THROUGH THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE BEDSIDE SUPPORT AND ADAPTIVE HOUSING, TRANSPORTATION, AND EQUIPMENT; HELP FOR VIETNAM VETERANS, CHILDREN, AND CAREGIVERS; AS WELL AS RELIEF IN TIMES OF CRISIS, DISASTER, AND EMERGENCY. IN FISCAL YEAR 2023, SEMPER FI & AMERICA'S FUND PROVIDED FAMILY SUPPORT GRANTS TO 10,900 SERVICE MEMBERS, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: OUR INTEGRATIVE WELLNESS PROGRAM APPLIES A HOLISTIC APPROACH TO LONG-TERM HEALTH, PROVIDING TOOLS TO IMPROVE MIND, BODY, AND SPIRIT. IN ADDITION TO POST-TRAUMATIC STRESS DISORDER AND TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY SUPPORT, WE FOSTER HEALING IN A POWERFUL AND SUSTAINING WAY THROUGH CUTTING-EDGE TECHNOLOGIES, HIGH-TECH WELLNESS DEVICES, AND OUR INNOVATIVE NEUROFITNESS PROGRAM. AREAS OF ASSISTANCE ALSO INCLUDE OUR SPORTS PROGRAM, HORSEMANSHIP PROGRAM, CANINE COMPANION PROGRAM, AND THERAPEUTIC ARTS AND MUSIC PROGRAM. IN FISCAL YEAR 2023, SEMPER FI & AMERICA'S FUND PROVIDED WELLNESS GRANTS TO 2,800 SERVICE MEMBERS, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: OUR TRANSITION PROGRAM FOCUSES ON HELPING VETERANS CONNECT WITH THEIR COMMUNITIES BY PROVIDING A WIDE RANGE OF EDUCATION AND CAREER ASSISTANCE, INCLUDING OUR APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAM, ONE-ON-ONE MENTORSHIP, AND OPPORTUNITIES TO ENGAGE WITH FELLOW VETERANS. THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES OUR VETERANS WITH THE SKILLS AND RESOURCES NEEDED TO SUCCEED IN THE NEXT PHASES OF THEIR LIVES. IN FISCAL YEAR 2023, SEMPER FI & AMERICA'S FUND PROVIDED TRANSITION GRANTS TO 1,800 SERVICE MEMBERS, VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.PersonNm: GEN JOHN PAXTON JR USMC RET

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF DONOR-RESTRICTED FUNDS ESTABLISHED TO SUPPORT THE ORGANIZATION'S OPERATIONS AND MISSION.

THE ORGANIZATION FOLLOWS US GAAP RELATED TO THE RECOGNITION OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THE ORGANIZATION RECOGNIZES ACCRUED INTEREST AND PENALTIES ASSOCIATED WITH UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AS PART OF THE STATEMENT OF ACTIVITIES WHEN APPLICABLE. MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT THE ORGANIZATION HAS NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AT JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022 AND THEREFORE NO AMOUNTS HAVE BEEN ACCRUED.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: USO EXPERIENCE 2023 AND USO EUROPE PROGRAM IN A BOX.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: FAMILY RELATIONSHIP WITH A KEY EMPLOYEE
FAMILY RELATIONSHIP WITH A KEY EMPLOYEE

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN DECEMBER 2022, THE ORGANIZATION AMENDED ITS BYLAWS RELATED TO THE SECRETARY OF THE BOARD. THAT OFFICER OF THE BOARD HAD BEEN REQUIRED TO BE A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. IN THE AMENDED BYLAWS, THE SECRETARY IS REQUIRED TO BE AN EMPLOYEE OF THE ORGANIZATION AND IS NOT A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS INITIALLY REVIEWED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE AND SENIOR MANAGEMENT. AFTER CHANGES, IF ANY, ARE MADE, THE FORM 990 IS THEN PROVIDED TO THE ENTIRE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO BEING FILED. THE FORM 990 IS FILED ONCE IT IS APPROVED BY THE ENTIRE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SF&AF REQUIRES AN ANNUAL STATEMENT FROM EACH BOARD MEMBER DISCLOSING ALL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. PERIODIC REVIEWS OF THESE ANNUAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE BY VARIOUS MEMBERS OF THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION OF TOP MANAGEMENT IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE IS MADE UP OF INDEPENDENT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD. THE COMMITTEE DISCUSSES COMPARABLE COMPENSATION IN OTHER ORGANIZATIONS, REVIEWS NON-PROFIT COMPENSATION SURVEYS AND KEEPS CONFIDENTIAL RECORDS OF THE COMMITTEE'S DELIBERATIONS. THE COMMITTEE THEN PRESENTS ITS FINDINGS AND RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE FULL BOARD WHO DETERMINES AND APPROVES THE COMPENSATION AMOUNTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANY PERSON CALLING OR E-MAILING THE ORGANIZATION IS PROVIDED A COPY OF THESE DOCUMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SF&AF'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, FORM 990 AND PRIVACY POLICY ARE ALSO AVAILABLE ON SF&AF'S WEBSITE.
